meanings.definition: The quality of being clear enough to read or decipher.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's handwriting had excellent legibility, making it easy for the students to understand.
meanings.sent2: The legibility of the sign on the road helped drivers navigate safely.
meanings.sent3: The detective's magnifying glass increased the legibility of the tiny print, revealing the hidden message.
meanings.sent4: The fog lifted, bringing legibility to the once blurry words on the page.
meanings.sent5: The legibility of the map was crucial for the hikers to find their way through the forest.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being easily readable.
meanings.sent1: The legibility of the font on the website made it accessible to all users.
meanings.sent2: The legibility of the menu at the restaurant helped customers choose their meals quickly.
meanings.sent3: The legibility of the book's text was so good that even a child could understand it.
meanings.sent4: The legibility of the road signs was like a beacon guiding the lost travelers.
meanings.sent5: The legibility of the instructions was essential for assembling the furniture correctly.
